meanings.definition: (adjective) tending to attract attention because of their exuberance, confidence, and stylishness
meanings.sent1: The flamboyants outfit she wore to the party turned heads.
meanings.sent2: The peacock displayed its flamboyants feathers during the courtship dance.
meanings.sent3: His flamboyants hat matched his colorful personality perfectly.
meanings.sent4: The sunset painted the sky with flamboyants hues of orange and pink.
meanings.sent5: The flamboyants decorations at the event made it unforgettable.

meanings.sent1: She was known as the flamboyants of the group due to her bold fashion choices.
meanings.sent2: The flamboyants entered the room with a grand gesture, capturing everyone's attention.
meanings.sent3: The flamboyants always brought a touch of glamour to any gathering.
meanings.sent4: In the world of fashion, he was considered a true flamboyants.
meanings.sent5: The flamboyants stole the show with their charismatic presence.

meanings.definition: (verb) to behave in a flamboyant manner
meanings.sent1: She flamboyants around the stage, captivating the audience with her performance.
meanings.sent2: During the parade, the dancers flamboyants to the rhythm of the music.
meanings.sent3: He flamboyants through life, embracing every moment with enthusiasm.
meanings.sent4: The artist flamboyants with colors on the canvas, creating vibrant masterpieces.
meanings.sent5: The actor flamboyants on screen, bringing characters to life with flair.
